properties.areaDesc: Daviess, KY; Vanderburgh, IN; Henderson, KY; Webster, KY; Posey, IN; Spencer, IN; Union, KY; Warrick, IN
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 12 at 4:32PM CST until February 12 at 10:30PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Warrick County in southwestern Indiana...
Spencer County in southwestern Indiana...
Vanderburgh County in southwestern Indiana...
Posey County in southwestern Indiana...
Henderson County in northwestern Kentucky...
Daviess County in northwestern Kentucky...
Union County in northwestern Kentucky...
Webster County in northwestern Kentucky...

* Until 1030 PM CST Wednesday.

* At 428 PM CST, a trained weather spotter in southeast part of
Evansville reported heavy rain was occuring and water was filling
up ditches and ponding on roadways. One half to three quarters of
an inch has already fallen today. Flash flooding may be ongoing or
expected to begin before sunset.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Trained weather spotters and radar.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Evansville, Owensboro, Henderson, Mount Vernon, Boonville,
Newburgh, Morganfield, Providence, Chandler, Rockport, Sturgis,
Melody Hill, Breckinridge Center, Sebree, Dale, Darmstadt, Clay,
Poseyville, Uniontown and Lynnville.

Additional rainfall amounts of one to locally two inches possible
in the warned area.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you
can do so safely.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 10:30 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
